variables.description:
The opacity to use for the Slider's thumb ink. This will appear when the user
focuses with the keybord or touches the slider on a mobile device.

This opacity will be applied to the `$primary-color`.

usedBy.description: This includes the react-md Sliders Component scss.

focuses with the keybord.

This opacity will be applied to the `$primary-color`.

functions.description:
A helper function to validate that a `$primary-color` has a `-200` suffix when
using the dark theme. It doesn't actually output anything with sass-loader atm
though. :/

context.name: validate-slider-primary-color

parameter.name: light-theme
parameter.description: Boolean if the current theme is the light theme.

return.description: true if the primary color is valid or false if it is invalid.

mixins.description: This includes the react-md Sliders Component scss.

context.name: react-md-sliders

parameter.name: primary-color
parameter.description:
The primary color to use for the
    slider. This will be the non-disabled track's fill color and the non-disabled thumb's
    color. If you are using the `dark-theme`, This value should be the primary color with
    a `-200` suffix.

parameter.name: light-theme
parameter.description:
A boolean if the application using the
    light theme.

parameter.name: inlude-media
parameter.description: Boolean if the media queries should be included.

parameter.name: include-discrete
parameter.description: A boolean if the discrete slider's scss should be included.

parameter.name: include-editor
parameter.description: A boolean if the editable slider's scss should be included.

parameter.name: include-indicators
parameter.description:
A boolean if the small scss for displaying indicators/icons
    with the slider should be included.

usedBy.description:
Includes every component, transition, and typography including their
media queries if the `$md-media-included` variable is `true`. You can
modify any global variables before including this mixin to change the overall
theme.

context.name: react-md-everything

mixins.description:
This will theme the Slider component with an updated `primary-color` and
optionally a switch in themes.

context.name: react-md-theme-sliders

parameter.name: primary-color
parameter.description:
The primary color to use for the
    slider. This will be the non-disabled track's fill color and the non-disabled thumb's
    color. If you are using the `dark-theme`, This value should be the primary color with
    a `-200` suffix.

parameter.name: light-theme
parameter.description:
A boolean if the application using the
    light theme.

parameter.name: include-discrete
parameter.description:
A boolean if the discrete Slider scss should be
    themed as well.

usedBy.description:
Updates the styles of every component with the new theme colors. If there
are components that do not change if the `$light-theme` variable is the same,
their updated styles will not be included. This is useful if you want to switch
between the light or dark theme, or even the entire theme colors while keeping
the base css the same between all themes.

In addition, if the theme colors do not switch, those styles will not be created.
So this allows the same colors between light and dark themes.

If you switch between the light and dark theme, you will need to give a `$html-class-name`
That will nest every component inside.

context.name: react-md-theme-everything

mixins.description: This will update the discrete Slider with the new `$primary-color`.

context.name: react-md-theme-discrete-slider

parameter.name: primary-color
parameter.description:
The primary color to
    theme the discrete Slider with.

parameter.name: light-theme
parameter.description:
Boolean if the discrete Slider
    should be themed for the light or dark theme.

usedBy.description:
This will theme the Slider component with an updated `primary-color` and
optionally a switch in themes.

context.name: react-md-theme-sliders
